choices.answer: How fast reactants are changed to products
The amount of energy released
A rating given to each reaction
A cost for doing reactions
Any collision that occurs between particles
Particles collide with the minimum amount of energy required
When reactants are mixed
When you run into a wall and it doesn't hurt

questions.question: How does increasing the pressure of a gas affect the rate of reaction?

choices.answer: A higher pressure gives particles more energy
A higher pressure doesn't affect the rate of reaction
A higher pressure means particles collide more frequently
A higher pressure makes the particles smaller

questions.question: How does increasing temperature affect the reaction rate?

choices.answer: Increasing rate, particles have more kinetic energy
Decreasing rate, particles have less kinetic energy
No effect, temperature doesn't change rate

questions.question: How does increasing the surface area increase the rate?

choices.answer: Increasing the area, decreases rate
Surface area has no effect on rate
Increasing the area, increases the rate

questions.question: Why do catalysts increase the rate of reaction?

choices.answer: Catalysts lower the activation energy
Catalysts have no effect on the rate of reaction
Catalysts provide extra molecules
Catalysts break down and release energy for the reaction

questions.question: Calculate the rate of this reaction to 1 d.p. - amount of product 12.7 cm3 and time 36 s.

choices.answer: 0.357 cm<sup>3</sup>/s
0.4 cm<sup>3</sup>/s
2.8 cm<sup>3</sup>/s
0.4 s/cm<sup>3</sup>
How the temperature of a solution changes
How the cloudiness of a solution changes
How the thickness of a solution changes
How the density of a solution changes

questions.question: Why is the disappearing cross experiment subjective?

choices.answer: Different people see different cloudiness
You can't see properly into the flask
The stop watch is inaccurate

questions.question: What should you do to calculate the rate of reaction from a curve?

choices.answer: Measure the gradient of the curve
Take a tangent of the curve, calculate the gradient
Estimate the rate from the curve

questions.question: How does temperature affect the position of equilibrium? (Two possible answers)

choices.answer: Decreasing temperature, equilibrium shifts to favour exo
Increasing temperature, equilibrium shifts to favour endo
Decreasing temperature, equilibrium shifts to favour endo
Increasing temperature, equilibrium shifts to favour exo

questions.question: How does pressure affect the position of equilibrium?

choices.answer: Pressure increases, equil to side with fewest gas molecules
Pressure increases, equil to side with most gas molecules
Pressure decreases, equil to side with fewer gas molecules

questions.question: Concentration affects the equilibrium position of reactions of gases - true/false

choices.answer: True
False
